page.title: 01Introduction to Deeside
page.content: The 12 Km. block is located on the {North Easterly}border between{England {and Wales.}The landscape takes in the town of Flint, Clwyd, and the Dee estuary. The{Estuary}was once a busy shipping route and Flint became one of a number of towns along this industrial belt known as Deeside. Due to the shifting sands and silting, only the occasional small boat is seen on the Estuary today. The{town}with its highrise flats and Edwardian castle is a busy, friendly community with a population of{12 300.}Many people in the town were employed at { the local{Courtauld's Rayon}works and {Shotton Steel}works, but due to the recent closure of both these large plants, the town has suffered badly, 18% of the working population are now unemployed.{Enterprise Zones}are being created to attract small factories.
